channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: 'Serious' crash as vehicle hits number of people in Pontyclun
item.description: At least five ambulances are at the scene in Llantrisant Road, Pontyclun, near the Windsor pub.

item.title: Racism probe as 'bananas thrown at Cardiff City academy players'
item.description: Probe as former Cardiff City youth team footballer says he and a team-mate were racially abused.

item.title: Heatwave: Temperatures soar as Wales basks in hottest day of 2021
item.description: Wales recorded its hottest day of the year as four-day extreme heat warning ends.

item.title: Welsh NHS pay rise: Nurses 'not ruling out strike' after 3% offer
item.description: One nurse says the offer is "pitiful" and that people are leaving the profession "in droves".

item.title: Covid in Wales: Isolation for vaccinated contacts to end in August
item.description: Government spells out plans after 11,000 received isolation alerts in Wales in one week of July.

item.title: Investigation after man, 52, dies at city centre gym
item.description: Fellow gym members tried to save him with the gym's defibrillator as they waited for paramedics.

item.title: Covid: How many deaths have there been in Wales?
item.description: It is the highest number of deaths reported in a single day since 2 April, when five were reported.

item.title: Illegal dog breeder who mutilated puppies' ears jailed
item.description: Christopher Mae "cropped" dogs' ears which made them more valuable, magistrates are told.

item.title: NHS Wales: A&E waits longest in nine years as hospital admissions rise
item.description: More than 19% of the Welsh population is waiting for treatment, the figures also show.

item.title: Mike Smith: Former Wales and Hull City manager dies aged 83
item.description: Former Wales manager Mike Smith, the first non-Welshman to manage the national side, has died at the age of 83.

item.title: Post Office scandal: Postmasters to get up to £100,000
item.description: Subpostmasters wrongly convicted of offences during an IT scandal are to receive interim compensation.

item.title: Motorcyclist killed in crash on A44 near Aberystwyth
item.description: The motorcyclist died at the scene after crashing with a lorry near Aberystwyth on Wednesday.

item.title: NHS Wales pay rise offer: 'Claps don't pay the bills'
item.description: Nurses react to an offer of a 3% pay rise from Welsh government.

item.title: Covid: Young farmers' clubs lose half their flock in pandemic
item.description: Membership fell from around 4,000 to 2,000 during the pandemic, but is starting to improve.

item.title: Dinosaur footprint found by girl, 4, to go on display
item.description: The discovery by Lily may show how the extinct reptiles kept their feet on the ground.

item.title: Heatwave: Workers struggle to avoid 'unbearable' temperatures
item.description: For some workers, it is impossible to avoid the scorching temperatures during the heatwave.

item.title: Mayhill: ‘Rioters taught my son anger and hatred’
item.description: Adam Romain says his previously loving and calm son has become aggressive after witnessing a riot.

item.title: Heatwave: Stay safe in the sun, says Welsh Ambulance Service
item.description: The ambulance service urges people to take care as it faces a rising number of 999 calls.

item.title: British and Irish Lions furious at having South African TMO for first Test against Springboks
item.description: The British and Irish Lions are furious at the decision to have a South African as the Television Match Official for Saturday's first Test against the Springboks in Cape Town.

item.title: 2021 World Matchplay: Dimitri van den Bergh and Krzysztof Ratajski into semi-finals
item.description: Defending champion Dimitri van den Bergh beats world champion Gerwyn Price while Krzysztof Ratajski also reaches the semi-finals of the 2021 World Matchplay in Blackpool.

item.title: Concussion and sport: How the lives of ex-sportspeople have been affected by concussion
item.description: BBC Radio 5 Live speaks to former sportsmen and women and their families about how concussion has changed their lives.

item.title: John Eustace: Queens Park Rangers assistant boss a contender for Swansea City job
item.description: Queens Park Rangers assistant manager John Eustace is a leading contender to be the next Swansea City boss.

item.title: One-Day Cup: Glamorgan beat Warwickshire by two wickets
item.description: Glamorgan beat Warwickshire by two wickets with two balls to spare in a low-scoring One-Day Cup thriller in Cardiff.

item.title: Honiadau o fwlio hiliol yn academi CPD Caerdydd
item.description: Teulu plentyn sy'n honni ei fod wedi dioddef bwlio hiliol yn yr academi yn bryderus nad yw'r clwb yn trin yr honiadau'n ddigon difrifol.

item.title: Undeb i herio'r llywodraeth yn y llys dros reolau llygredd
item.description: NFU Cymru'n ennill yr hawl am adolygiad barnwrol yn ymwneud â'r polisi Pharthau Perygl Nitradau (NVZ).

item.title: 'Croeso gofalus' i iawndal £100,000 i is-bostfeistri
item.description: Is-bostfeistr o Ynys Môn a gafodd ei garcharu ar gam yn 2006 yn rhoi croeso gofalus i gyhoeddiad am iawndal i ddioddefwyr.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Gobeithion Takeshi
item.description: Y darlithydd Cymraeg o Tokyo sy'n rhannu ychydig o'i obeithion ar drothwy'r Gemau Olympaidd.

item.title: Morgannwg yn trechu Sir Warwig yn y Cwpan Undydd
item.description: Dechrau da i ymgyrch y Cymry yn y Cwpan Undydd gan ennill gêm agos iawn yng Nghaerdydd.
